page.title: 08Industry in our area.
page.content: Eighty years ago when the first carpenter's shop was built at Ffynnon Gynydd,there was already a very busy blacksmith here working in his shop under the chestnut tree.The two crafts men worked closely together as wheel- wright and carpenter.However,horses were replaced by tractors and work declined.Oldfashioned cowsheds were being replaced by larger multi-purpose buildings and the wheelwright and blacksmith of years ago became the {Constructional Engineers}of today.The same family now have a very large work shop on the same sight.They employ 3 inside the workshop,1 on the excavator and 3 constructing the barns.A draught sman draws up the plans.The steel is cut by a bandsaw,a chopper,a punching machine and a drill.A great deal of welding is carried out.The steel is paint sprayed.
